item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

Davidi2:

You are the only one who assumed I was taking the role of superiority

oh really

[quote=“Davidi2, post:40, topic:317267”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=413812.msg3064208#msg3064208 date=1261091911]
omg you are so cool! you can fucking pass input from a textfield!

and why the fuck would i make this a jar? you are such a fucking idiot. this is a one-class-application you useless faggot
[/quote]I didn’t think you would understand how to run a class file from a website. Can you? (inb4 you Google it.)[/quote]

and you wrongfully assumed i was stuck with the same retarded mentality as you:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:40, topic:317267”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=413812.msg3064208#msg3064208 date=1261091911]
omg you are so cool! you can fucking pass input from a textfield!

and why the fuck would i make this a jar? you are such a fucking idiot. this is a one-class-application you useless faggot
[/quote]I didn’t think you would understand how to run a class file from a website. Can you? (inb4 you Google it.)

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=413812.msg3086713#msg3086713 date=1262554834]

great fucking way of advertising your site, as well as getting more hits

ps lol @ ‘bug’ and platform dependency, u suck

edit: fucking lol’d at:

[code] public static void openURL(String s)
{
String s1 = System.getProperty(“os.name”);
try
{
if(s1.startsWith(“Mac OS”))
{
Class class1 = Class.forName(“com.apple.eio.FileManager”);
Method method = class1.getDeclaredMethod(“openURL”, new Class[] {
java/lang/String
});
method.invoke(null, new Object[] {
s
});
} else
if(s1.startsWith(“Windows”))
{
Runtime.getRuntime().exec((new StringBuilder()).append("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler ").append(s).toString());
} else
{
boolean flag = false;
String as[] = browsers;
int i = as.length;
for(int j = 0; j < i; j++)
{
String s2 = as[j];
if(flag)
continue;
flag = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
“which”, s2
}).waitFor() == 0;
if(flag)
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
s2, s
});
}

            if(!flag)
                throw new Exception(Arrays.toString(browsers));
        }
    }
    catch(Exception exception)
    {
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, (new StringBuilder()).append("Error attempting to launch web browser\n").append(exception.toString()).toString());
    }
}[/code]

The URL thing is so anyone can do it on and OS, rather then your retarded windows exec based commands. It’s the same thing I use in my clients.[/quote][/quote]

ps you are such a fucking idiot, making people seem delusional when you are the one who has a severe problem interpreting occurrences

item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:67, topic:317267”]I was talking to Abraham.

Davidi2:

[size=20pt]I assume you will get punished again.[/size]

Davidi2:

[size=20pt]I did not expect someone to extract the class file and decompile it[/size]

Just because I used the word also, does not mean I was talking to you. You have never gotten punished and didn’t extract the class files, so stop making false assumptions.

And at:

stop trying to act more superior than everyone and stop digging yourself a bigger hole.

  1. Get your own responses
  2. By saying that, you are implying that you are more superior.

Because you seem to be the same as Abraham and cannot respond while still respecting others feelings, it is pointless responding to you as well.

Good Bye.[/quote]

I think abraham would be insulted that you think he’s the same as me, and so am I. I just added my comment here to show that you should listen to what he’s telling you and you shouldn’t be so obnoxious as to break every possible programming rule you can, when he’s actually telling you what not to do. It’s just like a teacher telling a kid that they did their homework wrong, and the kid arguing that it’s all right when it’s blatantly not.

ps stop saying that you’re not posting anymore, try listening to what people say instead of trying to formulate the best response.

item.title: Download list parser
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“inertia, post:60, topic:317267”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=413812.msg3086789#msg3086789 date=1262558887]
I did not want to look up the exact code, so I guess laziness was another motive.
[/quote]

Stop blaming your shitness on lazyness, that’s no excuse. [size=30pt]I’m shit at Java[/size] and even I know that using System.getProperty(“user.home”) is a LOT better than the cack your method attempted to do.[/quote]

[quote=“Davidi2, post:61, topic:317267”]I do not need to use better methods, it does not matter at all. It is all in the code, and it works for Windows.

I do not need to support Linux, I do not need to use conventions, I do not need to use cleaner methods and I did not release this open source, so you cannot talk about my code at all. If I released it open source then you could tell me how to do it correctly. But the fact is I did not. I did not expect someone to extract the class file and decompile it just so they could flame me for the code I did not try to make pretty. [size=30pt]I am[/size] [size=50pt]also[/size] [size=30pt]shit at Java[/size], and I just really started to learn it a week ago while working on projects. I do this to learn, and to try to help. If you are going to flame me for closed-source inefficiency, you need to learn the rules of this forum. I would suggest you stop flaming, or I assume you will get punished again.

I take all of these things as learning experiences, not chances to improve you with code.[/quote]

[quote=“Davidi2, post:63, topic:317267”]No, I was talking to Abraham, as your post means nothing to me.

And how am I promoting the use of them if no one knew I had used them? The only way anyone found out was because of Abraham’s decompiling of the code I added.[/quote]

Do you see the link there? You were quite clearly talking to me, stop trying to act more superior than everyone and stop digging yourself a bigger hole.

item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:61, topic:317267”]I do not need to use better methods, it does not matter at all. It is all in the code, and it works for Windows.[/quote]well then WHY THE FUCK ARE YOU USING JAVA, you are defeating its main purpose

[quote=“Davidi2, post:61, topic:317267”]I do not need to support Linux,[/quote]maybe YOU dont need the application to run on linux, but if you are releasing something to the public, as you did with your useless attempt at an ‘applet-wrapper’ on my application, you should seek to make it runnable on any system if the language has the ability to do so. especially if the main application (mine) had already implemented platform-independency

Davidi2:

I do not need to use conventions, I do not need to use cleaner methods and I did not release this open source, so you cannot talk about my code at all. If I released it open source then you could tell me how to do it correctly. But the fact is I did not. I did not expect someone to extract the class file and decompile it just so they could flame me for the code I did not try to make pretty.

so now you are using your release of the closed-source ‘wrapper’ as an excuse for the flaws within the code? regardless whether you released the application open-sourced or not, if you expect one to use it, it should not be complete and utter shit

[quote=“Davidi2, post:61, topic:317267”]I am also shit at Java, and I just really started to learn it a week ago while working on projects. I do this to learn, and to try to help. If you are going to flame me for closed-source inefficiency, you need to learn the rules of this forum. I would suggest you stop flaming, or I assume you will get punished again.[/quote]its funny how you were previously assuming the role of superiority, while now you are excusing your bullshit with the ‘im new’ excuse

you seriously need to learn to differentiate between ‘flaming’ and actual criticism on your released applications for the public use

ps stop using invalid justifications for the sake of appearing to be correct

oh ya and FUCK OFF

item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:61, topic:317267”]I do not need to use better methods, it does not matter at all. It is all in the code, and it works for Windows.

I do not need to support Linux, I do not need to use conventions, I do not need to use cleaner methods and I did not release this open source, so you cannot talk about my code at all. If I released it open source then you could tell me how to do it correctly. But the fact is I did not. I did not expect someone to extract the class file and decompile it just so they could flame me for the code I did not try to make pretty. I am also shit at Java, and I just really started to learn it a week ago while working on projects. I do this to learn, and to try to help. If you are going to flame me for closed-source inefficiency, you need to learn the rules of this forum. I would suggest you stop flaming, or I assume you will get punished again.

I take all of these things as learning experiences, not chances to improve you with code.[/quote]

[quote=“Davidi2, post:48, topic:317267”]Well, knowing Abraham, I can assume he will rage me for doing this, but I decided to turn this into an executable applet so there is no work needed.

All you do is view the applet, and it saves an HTML file onto your computer that it opens after parsing.

Please note that it opens the HTML file in your default browser, no matter what it is. (If you use notepad to open HTML files, it will show up in notepad)

To change the default program:

[ul][li]Create/find any HMTL file[/li]
[li]Right click and select Open With -> choose program[/li]
[li]Choose any internet browser (chrome, firefox ect) and check the box that asks if you want to always use the selected program[/li]
[li]Push OK[/li][/ul]

Now it should work.

The site is:
http://davidscape.com/downloadlist.html
(There is a bug that I am fixing, it only shows a few from each page, sorry)
Ok I just figured out that the bug causes only the topics you have replied in to show up. If you logout and click the link, it all comes up, but if you stay logged on only those you have replied to show up. If you know how to fix please do tell :P[/quote]

By posting that you’re not writing your own cacky methods and keeping them to your self, you’re promoting the use of them. Also, this is a discussion not flaming, would you like people to tell you how much you suck like you’d tell a 6 year old that his writing looks like crap, whilst also sucking your dick?

ps I wasn’t previously punished, you’re talking to the inertianator now not the abraham.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP wrote:

A little edit.

Replace bw.write("[b][u]-" + m.group(3) + "[/u][/b]");

With bw.write("[b][u]-" + m.group(3) + "-[/u][/b]");

Read full topic

item.title: Download list parser
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:50, topic:317267”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=413812.msg3086703#msg3086703 date=1262554146]
great fucking way of advertising your site, as well as getting more hits

ps lol @ ‘bug’ and platform dependency, u suck

edit: fucking lol’d at:

[code] public static void openURL(String s)
{
String s1 = System.getProperty(“os.name”);
try
{
if(s1.startsWith(“Mac OS”))
{
Class class1 = Class.forName(“com.apple.eio.FileManager”);
Method method = class1.getDeclaredMethod(“openURL”, new Class[] {
java/lang/String
});
method.invoke(null, new Object[] {
s
});
} else
if(s1.startsWith(“Windows”))
{
Runtime.getRuntime().exec((new StringBuilder()).append("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler ").append(s).toString());
} else
{
boolean flag = false;
String as[] = browsers;
int i = as.length;
for(int j = 0; j < i; j++)
{
String s2 = as[j];
if(flag)
continue;
flag = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
“which”, s2
}).waitFor() == 0;
if(flag)
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
s2, s
});
}

            if(!flag)
                throw new Exception(Arrays.toString(browsers));
        }
    }
    catch(Exception exception)
    {
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, (new StringBuilder()).append("Error attempting to launch web browser\n").append(exception.toString()).toString());
    }
}[/code]

[/quote]
The URL thing is so anyone can do it on and OS, rather then your retarded windows exec based commands. It’s the same thing I use in my clients.[/quote]are you honestly still under the false assumption that you are more knowledgeable than i am? if i point out flaws in your repugnant code, it is because i know the clean alternative

in this case, even when you were attempting to make the application portable, you failed. if the user is running neither a windows os nor a mac os, the application will fail to run since your final ‘else’ block will not do what you expected it to, and because the os will most likely not contain a path to ‘C:/Program Files’ (ie any linux distribution)

the correct way of doing it is using the standard api to ‘browse’ the generated html file using the java.awt.Desktop.browse function, and instead of saving the file in a non-portable directory you could have use ‘System.getProperty(“user.home”)’ (which is portable)

your whole function could have been replaced with one single line:

Desktop.getDesktop().browse(new URL("file:///" + System.getProperty("user.home") + "/list.html").toURI());

and this is 100% portable

go get a fucking clue

Read full topic

Your ego is obviously to large to appreciate anything, and you obviously need to put other people down to feel better about yourself.

item.title: Download list parser
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Well, knowing Abraham, I can assume he will rage me for doing this, but I decided to turn this into an executable applet so there is no work needed.

All you do is view the applet, and it saves an HTML file onto your computer that it opens after parsing.

Please note that it opens the HTML file in your default browser, no matter what it is. (If you use notepad to open HTML files, it will show up in notepad)

To change the default program:

[ul][li]Create/find any HMTL file[/li]
[li]Right click and select Open With -> choose program[/li]
[li]Choose any internet browser (chrome, firefox ect) and check the box that asks if you want to always use the selected program[/li]
[li]Push OK[/li][/ul]

Now it should work.

The site is:
http://davidscape.com/downloadlist.html
(There is a bug that I am fixing, it only shows a few from each page, sorry)
Ok I just figured out that the bug causes only the topics you have replied in to show up. If you logout and click the link, it all comes up, but if you stay logged on only those you have replied to show up. If you know how to fix please do tell

Read full topic
